 void pauseListening()
          method to suppress recognition listening events This is important when Sphinx is listening --> then Speaking, typically you don't want Sphinx to listen to its own speech, it causes a feedback loop and with Sphinx not really very accurate, it leads to weirdness -- additionally it does not recreate the speech processor - so its not as heavy handed

Method Detail

recognized

public java.lang.String recognized(java.lang.String word)
The main output for this service. "word" is the word recognized. This has to be setup before by calling createGrammar (" stop | go | new | grammar ") and a list of words or phrases to recognize.

Parameters:
word -
Returns:
the word

listeningEvent

public void listeningEvent()
Event is sent when the listening Service is actually listening. There is some delay when it initially loads.

createGrammar

public boolean createGrammar(java.lang.String grammar)
createGrammar must be called before the Service starts if a new grammar is needed example: Sphinx.createGrammar ("ear", "stop | go | left | right | back"); ear = Runtime.create("ear", "Sphinx")

Parameters:
filename - - name of the Service which will be utilizing this grammar
grammar - - grammar content
Returns:

stopRecording

public void stopRecording()
stopRecording - it does "work", however, the speech recognition part seems to degrade when startRecording is called. I have worked around this by not stopping the recording, but by not processing what was recognized

Overrides:

pauseListening

public void pauseListening()
method to suppress recognition listening events This is important when Sphinx is listening --> then Speaking, typically you don't want Sphinx to listen to its own speech, it causes a feedback loop and with Sphinx not really very accurate, it leads to weirdness -- additionally it does not recreate the speech processor - so its not as heavy handed

public void resumeListening()

isSpeaking

public boolean isSpeaking(java.lang.Boolean talking)
an inbound port for Speaking Services (TTS) - which suppress listening such that a system will not listen when its talking, otherwise a feedback loop can occur

b -
Returns:
